intro: Acronema paniculatum, commonly known as the white wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a member of the Violaceae family and typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its stems and leaves contain mucilage, which can be used in traditional medicine for its soothing properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
